title: Paying for College  · Angelo State University
description: Paying for college is a big deal. Learn about ASU tuition and fees, financial aid, scholarships, grants, loans, work study and more.

headings: How to Apply for Financial Aid
paragraphs: We understand that paying for college is a big deal.

At Angelo State, we’re committed to making your college experience one of the best investments you’ll ever make. We’ll provide you with a high-quality education at a cost that will help you graduate in four years (or less!) with as little debt as possible.

Nine out of 10 Angelo State students receive some form of financial aid. We offer a variety of financial aid options, including several based exclusively on financial need. For 2023-24, we awardedover $69 millionthrough scholarships, grants and other aid programs.
ASU administers more than 600 different scholarship programs, and you could earn up to $52,000 over four years.
Learn More
ASU offers several grant programs that are based on financial need as determined by your FAFSA. The best part is, grants don’t have to be repaid.
If you have significant financial need, you may qualify forfree tuitionto attend Angelo State!
Loans are a common form of financial aid and are available through federal, state and private programs.
Get a part-time job either on or off campus to help pay for college.
Whether you are active duty or a veteran, our VETS Center staff will help you access and make the most of your military and VA education benefits.
Connect, lead and secure your path to afree college education!
There’s a lot to consider when it comes to how you’ll pay for college. We’re with you every step of the way!
Receiving your education at Angelo State will be one of the best investments you’ll ever make.
Review specific costs for the number of semester credit hours you plan to take.
Anticipate the federal financial aid you may qualify for based on the new Student Aid Index (SAI) for the 2024-25 award year.
Apply your scholarships and financial aid to see what your out-of-pocket cost will be.
See the step-by-step process to apply for financial aid and find out what happens after applying.

“Angelo State is such a special and unique place. You don’t find many schools with the prestigious education provided and generous scholarship opportunities.”

Sierra Brooks, Class of 2022

“Knowing that I’m going to graduate from ASU without any debt gives me incredible peace of mind. I just feel very blessed to have received these opportunities.”

Tressa Reading, Mathematics, Pre-Health Professions Program, Class of 2024

“Getting a degree from ASU helped me graduate debt-free, thanks to my scholarship.”

Jordan Sefcik, Class of 2012

“My college education was self-funded, so I chose Angelo State because it offered me the best opportunity to earn a high-quality computer science degree at an affordable cost.”

Bryan Heflin, Owner, Best Made Designs, LLC, Class of 1987

“I am very blessed because of the scholarships I’ve received. Because donors are willing to help so much enables individual students to have peace of mind about their finances and focus on their academic interests and activities. I’m incredibly grateful that they chose me.”

Tressa Reading, Mathematics, Pre-Health Professions Program, Class of 2024

“The multiple scholarships I have earned allowed me to continue my studies, even with the recent pandemic, which has severely affected my family. I am more than grateful to have been granted the opportunity of studying in ASU and I appreciate every single bit of help that I have been given.”

Eduardo Aguirre Serrata, Chemistry

“I cannot express enough the value of ASU. You won’t walk out of here saddled with enormous debt, and that’s no small thing. ASU really offers an exceptional and accessible education.”

Dr. Michael Patyrak, Lead Team Radiologist, Dallas Cowboys, Class of 2002

“Angelo State University prides itself in offering an affordable, quality education through the ASU Distinguished Scholarship. The ASU Distinguished Scholarship is so influential in helping students afford tuition and plan for their future careers.”

Rachel Riggs, Class of 2014 and 2016

“I chose Angelo State because it was one of the few schools I applied to that made financial aid feel accessible and not something to be ashamed of.”

Edina Darnell, Management, Class of 2026

“Without these scholarships, I’d just be dreaming. But now, I can actually make it happen.”

Macy McNutt, Animal Science

“Receiving the ASU Distinguished Scholarship was very beneficial to me because it helped me get books and cover what was left over that financial aid didn’t pay. I wouldn’t have gotten that kind of scholarship somewhere else.”

Marcus Jasso, Class of 2024, Nursing

“Without the Carr Scholarship, I wouldn’t be where I am today. I definitely wouldn’t be a Ram, which is a major accomplishment in my life.”

Cesar Amezcua, B.B.A., Class of 2003

“My goal with college was that my family wouldn’t have to pay for any of it. Thanks to ASU’s scholarships, I haven’t had to pay a cent out of my own pocket.”

Hope Jenson, Biology, ROTC

“Because of the scholarships, I’m not constantly worried about working to support myself or pay for college. I can invest that time and effort into extracurricular activities.”

Tressa Reading, Mathematics, Pre-Health Professions Program, Class of 2024

“The athletic scholarship allowed me to pursue my dreams of attending nursing school while playing the game I love.”

Courtney Barnhill, Softball
